RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 1 1 1/8M Outer turf CR: 75. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. OUTER TURF FOR VA RESTRICTED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $25,000 In Last 5 Starts). (Rail at 82 feet). over the Turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Eighth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POR UNA CABEZA tracked the pace three wide, coaxed along on the t urn, made a three wide bid off the turn and had a long drive to get up late under a drive. WARIDI CANDY stalked the pace two wide, stalked the pace and made a two wide bid on the turn in hand, then took over off the turn to gain a short lead, then had a long drive but was caught late and out-gamed late. AFRAID NOT was rated along on the inside, tipped out three wide and finished willingly but needed more. KRONE was reserved early on the inside, swung out five wide leaving the turn and had a mild late rally. DETERMINED EMPIRE was settled early two wide, swung out four wide for the drive and had no kick. HOT BOTTOM GIRL was bumped at the start, set the pace on the inside and gave way the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Krone
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, swung 5 wide, mild rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Afraid Not
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, tipped 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Waridi Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide turn, long drive, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Hot Bottom Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, set pace inside, gave way stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Determined Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, swung 4 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Por Una Cabeza
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, long drive, up late, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less $20,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KATRIEL broke alertly to take command from the gate, raced wide while on a clear lead, remained five wide through the turn, drifted out to the seven path turning for home and was kept to task and widened his advantage as much best. IMPERIALTY raced prominently in the early going, was taken back entering the turn, circled wide turning for home and finished willingly. CONNECTAMUNDO stalked the pace from the fence to loom up turning for home and finished evenly to be out-kicked in the drive. COAL MINER broke a step slow to be at the rear of the field and made a mild bid down the lane. MR. RUIZ tracked the early pace to the turn and steadily dropped back to be no threat. BANKER BLAYNEY well placed to be up close through the turn and faded coming home. DIALED IN A PANIC was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Dialed in a Panic
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Connectamundo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace inside, finished evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Coal Miner
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Banker Blayney
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Imperialty
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back, circled wide, finished willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Katriel
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, clear lead, raced wide, kept on, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Ruiz
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, dropped back, no threat,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 3 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 89. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 40000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since Augu st 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KIZZY set the pace on the inside while clear, remained clear by the furlong marker and then held sway late to prove best under a drive. INANNA'S QUEST was rated early between rivals, then waited by the quarter pole towards the inside, tipped out leaving the turn for aim, finished well but could not get to the winner, second best. BALI KUTA chased the pace three wide, ridden along on the turn, came four wide into the lane and had a mild late kick to gain the show award. PANOTTI was reserved early on the inside, shifted out and advanced five wide by the quarter pole, came wide into the lane and had a late rally for the last spot in the superfecta. BEASTIE GIRL was settled early on the inside, swung out three wide leaving the turn and a belated rally. STARRY HOPE tracked the pace two wide, made a bid two wide on the turn and came three wide but weakened. DIVINE EXCHANGE was settled early two wide and then lacked a rally. SUWANNEE CHICK chased the pace on the inside and weakened. MISTY MAUVE was reserved early two to three wide, advanced four wide by the quarter pole and then was empty, no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Kizzy
ENTRY.COMMENT: set unchallenged pace inside, held sway late, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Suwannee Chick
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Beastie Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, swung 3 wide, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Panotti
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, 5 wide 1/4 pole, came 6 wide, late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Misty Mauve
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 2-3 wide, 4 wide 1/4 pole, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Starry Hope
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide turn, came 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Exchange
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle 2 wide, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Bali Kuta
ENTRY.OWNER: Serio Racing Stables and LaBerge Christopher
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, ridden along turn, came 4 wide, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Inanna's Quest
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated between horses, waited 1/4 inside, tipped 2 wide, rallied

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 4 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 76. Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less $20,000). (Rail at 12 feet). f course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LAKESIDE GETAWAY bobbled leaving the gate, raced up the rail under stout restraint off heels into the first turn, settled to prompt the pace down the backside, rallied two wide turning for home and quickly opened a clear advantage and was never threatened in the lane. GOOD ACCELEBRATE slow early to be at the back of the field while patiently handled, saved ground rallying up the rail in the far turn, tipped out around the stopping pacesetter in upper stretch and finished willingly to gain the place. TRIBEST (ARG) tracked the pace from the rail through the far turn, angled three wide at the head of the lane and rallied down the lane without being able to get by. WAY TOO EARLY reserved off the leaders through the turn, was called upon turning for home and lacked a good enough closing kick while failing to change leads. STAR FOX rank early, pulled to lead, opened clear margin down the backside and stopped turning for home. ONE VIOLENT AFFAIR rated off the lead near the rear of the field, started to rally into the turn, bobbled in turn, was taken in hand and finished as no threat. FIRELANE stalked the pace for three quarters and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Way too Early
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, rallied four wide, even late, no lead change

ENTRY.NAME: Lakeside Getaway
ENTRY.OWNER: R D M Racing Stable and Trombetta Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, hard held, off heels,prompt pace, cleared

ENTRY.NAME: Firelane
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 2w, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Good Accelebrate
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground, tipped out, finished willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Tribest (ARG)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, angled 3 wide, rallied stretch, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: One Violent Affair
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat, bobbled far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Star Fox
ENTRY.OWNER: StarLadies Racing LNJ Foxwoods and Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck)
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, speed, clear lead, stopped

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 5 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 91. Allowance Purse 70000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR VA RESTRICTED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OHANA HONOR was reserved early, came six wide into the lane and closed full of run to hit the front nearing the sixteenth marker and drew away to prove much the best, driving. FINGAL tracked the pace two wide, shifted out on the turn and made a four wide bid off the turn, proved to be no match for the winner, held place award. SEVEN BRIDGES ROAD was allowed to settle early, shuffled back on the turn, came seven wide into the lane and had a late kick to gain the show award. VELOCE was settled three wide, made a five wide move off the turn but flattened out, lost show late. JUSTINTIMEFORWINE set the pace on the inside and weakened the final furlong. BRYCE CANYON was settled back early, angled out in the lane and had no rally. COMMANDER KEITH was rated between rivals early and weakened. SMALL FIELD was reserved early, three wide on the turn and came six wide into the lane and had no rally. BRUCE BANNER pressed the pace three wide, made a two wide bid on the turn and weakened. COPAZO chased the pace on the inside and tired. THE HAPPY GIANT failed to menace. REMEMBERING WILBUR was not a factor. ELEVATED FOREVER showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Copazo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Fingal
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, shift out, bid 4 wide, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Bruce Banner
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, bid 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Bridges Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 7 wide, late rally, got show

ENTRY.NAME: Remembering Wilbur
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Ohana Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Woodford Racing LLC and Hudson Jr Edward J
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, came 6 wide, closed full of run, drew away, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Elevated Forever
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Bryce Canyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, angled out stretch, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Justintimeforwine
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, weakened 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: The Happy Giant
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Commander Keith
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early, between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Small Field
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, 3 wide turn, came 6 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Veloce
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3 wide turn, bid 5 wide, flattened out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Da Hoss S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 6 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 104. Stakes Purse 150000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. No nomination fee, with $500 to enter and an additional $500 to start. Supplementary nominations of $2,000 each (which include entry and starting fees) may be made at time of entry. $150,000 Guaranteed, with 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights; Three-year-olds 122 lbs. Older 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstake since February 1, 2 lbs.; $45,000 other than maiden, claiming or starter on the turf twice in 2022-23, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 25, 2023 WITH 43 NOMINATIONS AND 3 SUPPLEMENTAL. (Rail at 82 feet). ace over the Turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five and One Half Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOBALS prompted the pace to the quarter pole, was set to a drive turning for home, idled in upper stretch and surged late in the drive determinedly to be up in time. ALOGON stalked the pace from the fence to the head of the lane, tipped out around the pacesetter in upper stretch, took command in deep stretch and was caught on the wire in a good effort. SOUPER QUEST sped to the lead in rapid fractions, opened a clear advantage in the turn, responded when challenged in upper stretch and was out-finished late in a game effort. BIZ BIZ BUZZ well placed tracking the pacesetters through the turn and rallied willingly down the lane. MAYA PRINCE broke a step slow to be at the rear of the field and made a late gain in the stretch. YES AND YES reserved off the pace to the stretch and failed to gain when called upon for the drive. MOMOS was never a threat. HIGH LIMIT ROOM raced four wide into the turn chasing the pace, mounted an early bid midway on the bend and gave way turning for home.

ENTRY.NAME: Momos
ENTRY.OWNER: Ironhorse Racing Stable LLC and Bobo Tami
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Maya Prince
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Biz Biz Buzz
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, mild bid, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Alogon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, saved ground, tipped out, led late, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Yes and Yes
ENTRY.OWNER: Gleaves Philip A Straus Jr Joseph R and Fitzsimons Jr Hugh
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, failed to gain

ENTRY.NAME: Souper Quest
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, clear lead, responded, out-finished

ENTRY.NAME: Nobals
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, long drive, surged late, determined

ENTRY.NAME: High Limit Room
ENTRY.COMMENT: early bid 4w, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Kitten's Joy S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 7 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 69. Stakes Purse 125000. INNER TURF FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. No nomination fee, with $400 to enter and an additional $400 to start. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which include entry and starting fees) may be made at time of entry. $125,000 Guaranteed, with 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Colts and Geldings, 122 lbs. Fillies, 119 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden or claiming at one mile or over, 2 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 25, 2023 WITH 36 NOMINATIONS AND 2 SUPPLEMENTAL. (Rail at 12 feet). nd One Sixteenth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOK TOK was well placed on the inside, tipped out three wide leaving the turn to make bid, then hit the front leaving the furlong marker and drew clear to prove best, driving. TRIPLE ESPRESSO was off slowly, settled back early, swung wide leaving the turn and closed the gap fast on the outside. DETERMINED SAIL set the pace getting over to the inside, was well handled and headed nearing the furlong marker and faded late, held show award. RANDAZZO chased the pace two wide, made a inside bid leaving the turn but needed more. BECAUSE THE NIGHT was reserved early, angled out nearing the quarter pole, came four wide into the lane and was in traffic, bumped with a foe by the furlong marker, then rallied late when clear. MISSION READY was allowed to settle early, two wide on the turn, then was bumped hard by the furlong marker and had a mild late rally. MANABI was five wide into the first turn, chased the pace on the outside and lacked the needed rally. MAINSTREAM SELLOUT prompted the pace two wide and made a bid on the turn but weakened in the drive. MASSIF was settled early, between rivals on the turn and had no rally. BLUE CREEK was void of early speed and then saved ground on the turn and lacked the needed rally. SKELLIG ISLAND tracked the pace three wide and then bumped a foe while tiring in the lane and weakened. SILVER FRONT was settled early in between rivals and tired. SHARP TONES chased the pace on the inside and checked nearing the quarter pole and stopped.

ENTRY.OWNER: Ashby Lynn A and Gotwals William R
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, checked 1/4, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Randazzo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 2 wide, bid inside, needed more

ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and St Elias Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, settled back, swung wide, closed gap,

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled between horses, tired

ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 2 wide turn, bumped hard 1/8, mild rally,

ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, chased pace outside, no rally,

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, bumped foe stretch, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Massif
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, between horses turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Creek
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, saved ground, no rally,

ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, angled out 1/4, traffic stretch, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Mainstream Sellout
ENTRY.OWNER: High Kings Racing LLC and Saville Niall
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide turn, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Determined Sail
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, well handled, faded 1/8, held show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Exacta Systems Rosie's S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 8 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 81. Stakes Purse 125000. OUTER TURF FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. No nomination fee, with $400 to enter and an additional $400 to start. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which include entry and starting fees) may be made at time of entry. $125,000 Guaranteed, with 60% to the ow ner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: Colts and Geldings, 122 lbs. Fillies, 119 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden or claiming, 2 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry bo x by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 25, 2023 WITH 43 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 82 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO NAY METS (IRE) broke sharp to take command from the gate, set a pressured pace in rapid fractions, cleared in upper stretch when called upon and drew away much the best. TOUPIE stalked the pace from the rail through the turn, angled three wide to mount a rally turning for home and finished well as second best. AIR RECRUIT tracked the leaders from two wide through turn, made a three wide rally at the head of the lane, and kept on through the drive to hold the show. ATMIDNIGHT rated in mid-pack from between rivals and made a good late gain through the lane. RUDDY BUDDY slow early to be at the rear and closed well down the stretch showing good late interest. SEBASTIAN RUN well placed in striking position through the turn and lacked a closing response. WOODCOURT bumped at the start to drop out to the rear of the field and made a steady non-threatening gain throughout. A G DIAMOND reserved off the leaders and failed to gain ground. KING KONTIE sped up from two wide to press the quick pace to upper stretch and weakened in the lane. MI DINERO was never a threat. GONE ELVIS showed brief speed and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Mi Dinero
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Ruddy Buddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, closed well late

ENTRY.NAME: Toupie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, saved ground, angled, finished well, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Woodcourt
ENTRY.OWNER: Qatar Racing Detampel Marc and Galvin Fergus
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: No Nay Mets (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Bregman Family Racing LLC and WWBD LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, speed, drew clear, much best

ENTRY.NAME: A G Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Sebastian Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, even late, lacked rally

ENTRY.COMMENT: rated midpack, good late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Gone Elvis
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back, through early,

ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, pressed pace, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Air Recruit
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, well placed, bid upper, kept on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Virginia Oaks COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 9 1 1/8M Outer turf CR: 97. Stakes Purse 250000. OUTER TURF FOR FILLIES, THREE-YEARS-OLD. No nomination fee. $500 to enter and an additional $500 to start. Supplementary nominations of $2,000 each (which include entry and starting fees) may be made at time of entry. $200,000 Guaranteed, with 60% to t he owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 122 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded Stake, 2 lbs., two races other than maiden, claiming or starter at one mile or over on the turf, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to b e named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 25, 2023 WITH 38 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 82 feet). ne Eighth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THIRTY THOU KELVIN set the pace along the inside, then was coaxed along on the turn, sent down leaving the turn, then was headed by the furlong marker, but dug in gamely and shook clear of that rival and then held off the fast closing ROOT CAUSE late to prove best, driving. ROOT CAUSE was reserved early on the inside, swung out three wide leaving the turn, split rivals nearing the furlong marker, then angled out for racing room and closed fast to just miss. ALPHA BELLA stalked the pace two wide, then was coaxed along on the turn to inch closer and made a two wide bid off the turn to go on even terms by the furlong marker but hung late. MISSION OF JOY was allowed to settle two wide, made a three to four wide move on the turn and continued that move off the turn but flattened out late. BEAUTIFULNAVIGATOR (IRE) was settled on the inside, swung out four wide leaving the turn, was blocked by the three sixteenths, angled out for racing room on the outside and had no kick while improving. TUFANI was rated along the inside and weakened in the drive. IDEA GENERATION (IRE) was rated two wide, made a three wide bid leaving the quarter pole but came up empty the final furlong. BROADWAY GIRLS was reserved two wide early and lacked a rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Root Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, swung 3 wide, split 1/8, angled out, closed,miss

ENTRY.NAME: Tufani
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.OWNER: Magdalena Racing (Sherri McPeek) and Riccio Alfred
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, swung 4 wide, blocked 3/16, angled out, no kick

ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 2 wide, bid 3 wide, empty stretch,

ENTRY.OWNER: ERJ Racing LLC Pappas Horse Racing Corp and Haymes Neil A
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 2 wide, lacked rally

ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, coaxed turn, headed 1/8, dug in gamely, held

ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle 2 wide, 3-4 wide move turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide, hung late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: New Kent County Virginia Derby - Grade3 COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 10 1 1/8M Outer turf CR: 102. Stakes Purse 500000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS. No nomination fee. $600 to enter and an additional $600 to start. Supplementary nominations of $3,000 each (which include entry and starting fees) may be made at time of entry. $300,000 Guaranteed, with 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded Stake at one mile or over, 3 lbs.; $40,000 other than maiden, claiming or starter at one mile or over on the turf, 5 lbs. Starters and ri ders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 25, 2023 WITH 38 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 82 feet). ile and One Eighth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INTEGRATION unhurried for the first five eighths to race two wide in mid-pack, rallied in the turn circling five wide and closed fast to prevail in the drive pulling clear late. PROGRAM TRADING (GB) raced five wide into the first turn, settled back in hand to be three wide heading up the backstretch tracking the leaders, swept up four wide to engage the leaders in upper stretch, took command in mid-stretch and was out-finished in the drive to the wire. RUNAWAY STORM sped to the lead into the first turn, set a pressured quick pace to the far turn, dug-in when challenged turning for home and kept on willingly to hold the show. MONDEGO (GB) well placed tracking the pace for the run down the backside, rallied to threaten in the lane and finished even late. DATAMAN reserved off the pace in hand down the backside while racing along the rail, saved ground turning for home and made a mild bid in the stretch. GIGANTE raced near the rear of the pack to the top of the lane and showed some late interest. ACTIVIST INVESTING (GB) slow early to trail most of the way and passed tiring rivals down the lane. SALUTE THE STARS prompted the pace to the far turn and gave way. ARI GOLD chased the pace four wide into the first turn, continued to stalk from three wide down the backside and faltered heading for home.

ENTRY.NAME: Gigante
ENTRY.OWNER: Iapetus Racing LLC and Diamond T Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, late interest

ENTRY.NAME: Runaway Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, pressured, responded, long drive, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Salute the Stars
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, tired, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Dataman
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, saved ground, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Mondego (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, bid stretch, even late

ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, circled 5 wide, closed fast, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Ari Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4 wide turn, stalked pace, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Program Trading (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide first turn, settled in hand, bid 4 wide turn, led, outfinish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Colonial Cup S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 11 1 1/2M Inner turf CR: 104. Stakes Purse 150000. INNER TURF FOR THREE- YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. No nomination fee, with $400 to enter and an additional $400 to start. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which include entry and starting fees) may be made at time of entry. $150,000 Guaranteed, with 6 0% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three-year-olds, 122 lbs. Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded Stake since January 15, 2 lbs.; two races other than maiden, claiming or startero ver one mile since then, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 25, 2023 WITH 41 NOMINATIONS AND 2 SUPPLEMENTAL. (Rail at 12 feet). ace over the Turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Half).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STARTING OVER was well placed along the inside, sat in the pocket past the quarter pole, tipped out three wide to make a bid and went on even terms by the furlong marker and then drew clear to prove best under a drive. DYNADRIVE was reserved early, ranged up in upper stretch between rivals, angled in and closed well to gain the place award. MCLOVIN was settled back early, swung out wide leaving the turn and finished well late. SY DOG stalked the pace three wide, made a two wide bid nearing the quarter pole and took over off the turn, then was headed by the winner by the furlong marker and faded late. GLIDER was rated two to three wide, came five wide off the turn making a bid but had no late kick. AJOURNEYTOFREEDOM tracked the pace and was two wide on the far turn and weakened in the drive. MONAASIB chased the pace on the inside and tired. TEMPLE was bumped at the start, set the pace on the inside and gave way in the lane, eased the final furlong, walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Starting Over
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, pocket turn, tipped 3 wide, bid, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: McLovin
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, swung wide upper stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Monaasib
